title: Re: PCKF, dead?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr] why is bill gates your avatar?[hr][/quote]
EXACTLY!

I had better things to worry about than posting here.

I refuse to post in the stupid topics in the misc forums.

I try to post as little as possible.

Now how that has any bearing on the PCKF is beyond me. I just wanted to justify myself not being around. What is YOUR excuse? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] -----------------------

title: DIE!
content:
Gaaaaahh!![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stoned.gif[/img] Yet another one of these topics![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] If one more person opens a topic like this (excluding any made in response to this statement) I'm gonna get Mortlol on your asses.

There's obviously more activity than you can keep up with if you haven't read the countless posts about this very subject, and my constant rebuttals that the PCKF is not dying!

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-bloody.gif[/img] Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

Keen's just dying, dude. I mean, I will never forget CK, but I have more pressing things on my mind. I guess we just need something good to come hit the forum.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: *sigh*
content:
[hr]rorie there's no need to offend, spleen, i started this topic because we don't get much traffic like we used to
[hr]And no offence have I inflicted. This is officially the last post I'm writing in response to anything on this matter: take a look at all the projects that are in the works--including the ones that allow us easy editing of practically every single Keen game, the fast approaching first ever full mod of Keen4, of which I've seen some mindblowing betas, and WIP ports of both the Vorticons and Galaxy series for Windows--and find a way to contact the 20-something MSN Keeners of which about 10 are frequently online [not much? Consider that it's grown from, uh, zero since a couple of years ago]. Then tell me Keen is dying (not that I'll respond).

And when did we ever get "much traffic like we used to"? This forums always been slow apart from annoying spam topics about controversy and the death of Keen. For most of the 90s there was no PCKF. No mods. We just had the original games to keep the spirit alive.

I have more pressing things to attend to as well, but that's not going to keep me from modding and coding new Keen stuff.

That's my last word on the matter. Enjoy. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: PCKF, dead?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]because i welcome all the work & time he has put into disease & poverty & all the billions he has spent[hr][/quote]

Wait, Mr AntiBush, america sucks, stupid capitalists like the big G?

No wonder you're starting topics liek this, you're delerious.

Bugger if Keen is dying and bugger anyone who thinks so; I've said before why I think Keen is still going strong, and I'm not going to repeat myself for people who just don't listen.

Keen is dying, waa waa waaa, whatever. I'm having a good time now, will have a good time in future and have enjoyed Keen in the past, everything dies so just get off your rear and enjoy Keen while he's here.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: PCKF, dead?
content:
"For most of the 90s there was no PCKF. No mods. We just had the original games to keep the spirit alive."
Yes, this is rather important to remember. Mods didn't came out until 2002 (or 2003, can't remember that far).3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
